DOC.brief_summary: This study will compare cataract patients with implantation of diffractive multifocal IOL with an additional power of +2.75 diopters (Group 1) and with +3.25 diopters (Group 2). Evaluations will be performed 1 and 3 months following cataract surgery, including measurement of uncorrected distance visual acuity (UDVA), refractive error (manifest refraction [MR]), and uncorrected near visual acuity (UNVA) at 33, 40, and 50 cm. At 3 months, internal aberrations and contrast sensitivity will be evaluated and subjects will complete a questionnaire on outcomes satisfaction, visual symptoms, and spectacle use.
DOC.brief_title: Comparative Study of Two Multifocal Intraocular Lens With Different Add Power
DOC.criteria: age >= 18 cataract patients with lens opacities classification higher than grade III patients who desire to be spectacle indepence for distance and near vision previous ocular surgery or trauma presence of corneal opacities fundus abnormalities glaucoma uveitis amblyopia systemic disease posterior capsule rupture during cataract surgery
